Hi all

We've a couple of places where we have threads waiting for eachother using
java's wait() and notify() design. In general it worked fine. However every
now and then (depending on user actions and what else the machine has
running) we'd run into the problems "Missed notification" and "Early
notification" which are described in thread books such as Paul Hyde's "Java
Thread Programming". Solutions to these "standard" problems are also given
in the thread books so we have now solved the problem.

What we do not have is a test that tells us that we've solved the problem!
We only have tests that generally pass even when the problem is there!

We would like to write a test that specifically tests our wait()-notify()
constructs for robustness against "Missed notification" and "Early
notification". Has anybody already though through how best to test this? Or
does anyone have a reference to an article or web where this test may be
described in a generic way or with an example?

Thanks in advance.

Morten
